text: MUSIC: Steely Dan's blues\funk classic "Daddy Don't Live That New York City No More".. We're in midtown. The 15TH PRECINCT BUILDING. DETECTIVE TONY CARUSO, JR. pulls up out front. He gets ou and starts up the steps. Then he pauses. He's noticed some LITTER on the sidewalk. A plastic cup o fast-food wrapper. Tony picks it up, and dutifully drops into a TRASH CAN. Then he continues up the steps. Through the doors. To sta work. NOTE: This credit sequence will ALTER SLIGHTLY each episo As Tony arrives for work, he'll stop and perform a DIFFER SMALL ACT OF KINDNESS. One time he'll hold somebody's umbrella, one time he'll help carry a baby stroller, etc. He's a good cop.

head_text.subj: EXT. POLICE TRAINING FACILITY- BRONX, NY- DAY

text: CLOSE ON: a PAPER TARGET, a SILHOUETTE OF AN ARMED THUG. shooter's aim is PERFECT. A tight cluster, around the hea We're at Rodman's Neck, a huge training facility in the Bronx. It's like a Hollywood backlot. Fake buildings. Moc bad guys. Another TARGET swings into view. The shooter spins! BLAM BLAM! The shooter is LT. TONY CARUSO JR, lead detective on New York's elite All-City Homicide Squad. A man of quiet authority. Clean cut. Deliberate. Focused. Tony continues to shoot. BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM!

head_text.subj: INT. TRAINING FACILITY- MAIN OFFICE- LATER

text: Tony is at the counter. The range supervisor, SGT. CHET FINCH, a weathered, veteran cop, tallies up his score.
982. That's a range record. The highest your old man ever got was 800.
He probably cheated.
I know he cheated.

head_text.subj: EXT./INT. TONY'S CAR- INTERSECTION- BROOKLYN- NIGHT

text: It's late. Tony and his father are driving home. BIG TONY is a natural-born hustler. Irreverent. Shameless We don't want to love him, but we love him. They're stopped at a RED LIGHT. The streets are empty. Brooklyn is dead. You would run this light. So would I. Anybody would. But Tony is a boy scout. Obsessively hones
You can go. (beat) The light's busted. You can go. Tony doesn't move. BIG TONY (CONT’D) It's been busted all week.
I'm gonna give it a minute.
You don't believe me?
If you told me you were lying, I wouldn't believe you.
That's very funny. That's a nice way to talk to your father. (then) I talked to Chet Finch. He said you crushed it at the range on Saturday.
You talked to Chet Finch?
It didn't surprise me. You could always shoot. Remember Boy Scout camp? You won all those medals-
Badges.
Badges. Whatever.
If you were there, you would know.
I wasn't there. I was a shitty dad. But it doesn't matter now because we're both gonna die tonight in this car. They're gonna find us tomorrow, staring at that facacta light, dead of starvation.
You're not supposed to have contact with anyone in the department.
It wasn't contact.
That's a condition of your parole-
It wasn't contact. We weren't exchanging bodily fluids. We talked for ten minutes.
That's contact! Conversation is contact! Especially with Chet Finch. He was on your crew, for God's sake.

Someone buys me a Heineken, I'm gonna sit down. That's how God made me. Especially if they're bragging on my boy.  4. A CAR behind them HONKS impatiently. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Now they're honking. (Tony doesn't move) You can go. You're a cop.
Exactly. I'm a cop.
You think running a red light is gonna turn you into me? Tony doesn't respond. Or move. HONK HONK. HONK. HONK.

Early morning. TWO TEENAGERS on DIRT BIKES roar through t park. CYCLISTS and JOGGERS scramble out of their way. There's something up ahead, lying across the trail. Holy shit! It's a BODY! The FIRST BIKER swerves! He wipes out! The Biker recovers, and takes a closer look. The Dead Man has been shot in the chest. Multiple times. And there's a BLACK PLASTIC BAG over his head.

head_text.subj: EXT. CARUSO HOUSE- BROOKLYN- SAME TIME

text: Tony and his dad share this modest row house in Bay Ridge They're a crime-fighting, multi-generational Odd Couple.

Tony's bedroom. As meticulous and orderly as he is. We PAN THE WALLS. PHOTOS of EVAN, his 8 year old son.. bo on Forensics, Abnormal Psychology.. medals and citations. And a makeshift case board, dedicated to his mother. Ther are old newspaper articles: HIT AND RUN KILLS MOTHER OF T And DIAGRAMS and PHOTOS of the corner in Queens where she killed. The ALARM CLICKS ON. It plays his favorite music, BOSSA NOVA.  5. Tony stirs. He opens a drawer in his nightstand, and remo his SERVICE REVOLVER, a Glock 19.
Downstairs. Big Tony is a foodie. He's preparing a multi- course gourmet Italian breakfast, while talking on the phone. .

(into phone) Diagonally? What does that mean? So diagonally is bigger? So the next time I measure my pecker I'm gonna measure it diagonally. Tony enters. BIG TONY (CONT’D) I'll catch you later. The girl from Ipanema just woke up. (hangs up) That was Wendell Kirk. He just found us a new TV. A 62 inch Vimeo.
We don't need a new TV.

It's a gift. What was I supposed to say? Sit down. Tony, sit. The first thing every cop learns: never pass up a real breakfast. You catch a case, who knows when you'll eat again. Big Tony lovingly serves his son breakfast. They're basically an old married couple. Tony eats a muffin. BIG TONY (CONT’D) You can't eat that dry. Put some butter on that.
When's your interview?
About ten.
Not "about ten". Ten. It's ten. It's a job interview. You should get there early.
Will you relax. You're making the coffee nervous.
I'm just saying. Gabby went to a lot of trouble-
She's Gabby now?
(embarrassed) Gabriel. Inspector Vasquez.
How cozy is that? My son and the bitch who can't wait to throw me back in jail.
I'm not involved with your P.O.
I'm not blind. I was at the release hearing. I had to step over your tongue to get out the door.
Do you have a shirt?
Yes I have a shirt.
With a collar? A real shirt?
Yes. With a collar. Who's the parent here?
Exactly. During this, Tony fiddles with a handheld BALL AND STRIKE COUNTER. CLICK CLICK CLICK.
For Evan's little league game. They asked me to umpire. Four o'clock. And you're coming. (Big Tony winces) Dad. You're coming. You haven't been to a game all year.
What would I do, sit in the bleachers with your ex and her lesbian wife?
You don't have to say "lesbian wife". You can just say wife. During this, Tony starts to use a NAPKIN. Then he puts it back, and tears off a PAPER TOWEL instead.
What are you doing?
I'm good.
(indicates the NAPKINS) Why? Because they say "Wendys"? You are pathological, you know that? They're just napkins! Everybody takes them!
That doesn't make it right. If you break one rule, they all break.
Hey. Don't have to quote your mother to me. I was married to the woman for 17 years.
You were married to her. But I listened to her. Big Tony collects the "stolen" napkins.
You know what, Saint Francis? This time I'm calling your bluff. You want me to return the napkins? (MORE )

Okay. You come with me. We'll go back to Wendys. We'll find the Manager. "Here are the ten napkins you've been looking for. I confess! It was me!" (waving a PACKET) Oh wait. Here's a Splenda from the I-Hop in Fairfield. I'11 mail it to them. During this, Tony's CELL PHONE RINGS.
(answering PHONE) Caruso. Yeah I'm catching. (listens) I'm leaving now.

head_text.subj: EXT. AMBROSE PARK- STAGING AREA- MOMENTS LATER

text: The park is now a FULL-ON CRIME SCENE. YELLOW TAPE. SQUAD CARS. A FORENSIC TEAM. AN AMBULANCE. Tony approaches the perimeter. TWO ROOKIE UNIFORMS are on duty. The First Rookie is unshaven.
Sgt. Loomis?
He's in the Camry.
Did you lose your razor, Officer?
No sir.
That's an infraction.
I'll take care of it. Thank you, sir. Tony walks away. After he's gone.. FIRST ROOKIE (CONT’D) (rolling his eyes) It's like having a den mother.
Who was that?
You heard of Tony Caruso? Diamond Tony? That's his son.
He's on the job?
Top of the food chain. All City Homicide.
He's a cop? (beat) And he didn't change his name?

head_text.subj: INT./EXT. LOOMIS'S SEDAN- STAGING AREA- SAME TIME

text: Tony approaches a PARKED SEDAN. His partner, DETECTIVE SG BURL LOOMIS, is behind the wheel. 50's. Rumpled. Cynical. Burnt out. He's fast asleep.
Hey Cowboy. What are you doing?
(groggy) Hhhmm. Waiting for you. Tony shakes Loomis. Offers him some coffee.
What if somebody saw you? They'd pull your badge.
Yeah. That would be terrible. I'd have to retire early.
Here's a question. When you do finally retire, how will anyone know?  10.
Tony & Loomis walk up a hill, toward the body. Loomis is of shape. He falls behind.
Don't wait for me. I promised your old man I'd watch your back, so that's what I'm doing. They reach the dump site. A uniform officer, SGT. CHEADLE greets them.
Lieutenant. Glad you're here. This one's a real freak show. Loomis joins them, wheezing from the climb.
(indicates Loomis) Well, we know HE didn't do it. (resuming, to Cheadle) Any I.D.?

Not yet. Nobody's touched him. It looks like a taxpayer. Tony examines the BODY. He's a world-class investigator. Out of respect, the other cops step away and give him spa SGT. CHEADLE (CONT’D) What the hell is wrong with this town?
Nothing a well-placed hydrogen bomb couldn't cure. The victim has been shot in the chest, multiple times. Pl there's a BLACK PLASTIC TRASHBAG over his head.
Should we cut the bag?
No. Let's wait for the good doctor.
Time of death?  11.
I'm guessing. Two days.
So Saturday night?
Maybe. This isn't the primary. He was killed somewhere else. (examines the shoes) No scuff marks. He wasn't dragged, he was carried. Who found him? Nearby: the DIRT BIKERS are being questioned.
A couple of dirt bikers. It's illegal in the park, so they ride at dawn.
Get a statement. Separately. Separate cars. And stay away from that bush.
Did you see something?
Yeah. Poison sumac.
(chuckles ) One of the perks of having a boy scout for a partner. Tony looks around. He misses nothing.
They parked down the hill. They carried him 35, maybe 40 yards. Why'd they leave him here, out in the open? Another ten feet they're in the woods.
Maybe they were interrupted.
Maybe. (beat) Maybe they wanted him found.  12.

head_text.subj: EXT. CARUSO HOUSE- STREET- SAME TIME

text: Back at the house. An young woman ROARS up on a vintage Sportster Harley Davidson. Meet GABRIEL VASQUEZ, Big Tony probation officer. Street smart, with a mischievous sense humor. Gabby on her chopper: the sexiest thing on the internet. She's parked in front of a FIRE HYDRANT. Gabby picks up a EMPTY TRASH CAN, flips it over, and drops it over the hydrant. Problem solved. An ELDERLY NEIGHBOR, sitting on a stoop, watches her. Gab smiles and winks.

head_text.subj: INT. CARUSO HOUSE- LIVING ROOM- SAME TIME

text: Inside. Big Tony is installing a NEW TV MONITOR with WENDELL, an old slacker friend.

Where's the other input? This wire's too big.. etc. Gabby enters. The guys are distracted and don't notice he She picks up the REMOTE and CLICKS THE TV OFF. For a beat, the guys are confused. They think the monitor broken. They finally notice Gabby.
I left you two messages.
I know. My phone died. Sorry.
(dimly ) Who is this? Gabby flashes her P.O. SHIELD.
"This" is Gabriel Vasquez. I'm his probation officer. Gabby picks up a TOWEL- twirls it, rolls it up- then SNAP LIKE A WHIP at Big Tony It nicks his ear. It bleeds a little.  13.
YOW! Are you allowed to do that?!
I doubt it. (to Wendell) Who are you?
(gulp) Wendell Kirk.
Wendell Kirk. Do you have a receipt for this TV?
It was a floor model. They don't give receipts-
Bullshit. You always get a receipt.
Not at Target.
You want a receipt? Give me twelve hours. I can get you a receipt.
Pack it up, Wendell. Wendell anxiously carries some boxes out the door.
I called the lumber yard. They said you showed up but then left before the interview.

Okay. Here's the thing. I got there. The supervisor was a guy named Randy Buttons. I don't know Randy too well, but I know his wife, Mrs. Buttons, very well. So I bailed. Believe me, I saved everyone a world of trouble.  14.
There's a
So we have to find an employer whose wife you never tapped?

It's a big city. There has to be someone. Gabby SNAPS THE TOWEL at him again. BIG TONY (CONT’D) YOW! Gabby, Inspector, give me some credit. I'm walking the line here. You asked me to sell my liquor license, I sold it, no problem. You asked me to move in with my kid, here I am. I'm walking the line. You gave me 90 days to find a job. I'll do it. I have three weeks left.
Three weeks, Tony. (sigh) Why do I let you slide like this?
Because you get me. Because we're kindred spirits. COLLECTION OF FAMILY PHOTOS on a wall. Gabby admires a photo of Tony, shirtless, at the beach. Any wom would. Gabby not
BIG TONY (CONT’D) (teasing her) You want a copy of that one?
Shut up. ices ANOTHER PHOTO: Big Tony and his ex-partner, NGSTON.
Is that Jack Livingston? Your ex- partner? I thought you hated him.
Hatred is too weak a word.  15.
Then why- ?
I keep that picture there to remind me what's really important in life.
What's that?
Outliving that prick. We ZOOM IN to the PHOTO OF JACK LIVINGSTON...

head_text.subj: EXT. AMBROSE PARK- CRIME SCENE- SAME TIME

text: Back at the crime scene. DR. ZEE, the Medical Examiner, i carefully cutting the BLACK BAG off the victim.
All right. Let's meet our mystery guest. The bag is cut away, revealing a familiar face. It's Jack Livingston! The ex cop. Big Tony's nemesis. Everyone recognizes him. A stunned beat.
Holy crispy crap.

Livingston's widow, DONNA, is identifying the body. Early 40's. Attractive to men, and she knows it. Tony and Loomis are there. So is their boss, CAPT. R.H. DELGETTY, DEPUTY CHIEF OF DETECTIVES. Ambitious. Marine- tough. Delgetty is restrained, soft-spoken.. which someho makes her more intimidating.
I don't know what I'm doing here. You knew him longer than I did.

The law says a family member, if possible. Whenever you're ready.  16. These days, victim IDs are done by close circuit. Delgett clicks on a MONITOR. Livingston's lifeless face appears. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) Is that your husband? Donna? I need you to indicate yes. Donna nods. She lovingly touches the monitor screen. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) Donna, I'm so sorry. I'm speaking for the whole department-
Save your tears, Captain. Jack was dead to you, to all of you, the minute he agreed to testify.

Nobody in this room thinks that. You know Tony Caruso and Burl Loomis. (Donna nods) They're on the All-City Homicide Squad. They're the best of the best. That's an indication of how seriously we're taking this. Loomis opens a notebook.
Donna, was Jack worried about anything? (Donna shakes her head) Did he have any enemies?

You have some nerve. Enemies? (indicates Tony, bitterly) Ask your partner. Ask his father. Everybody heard him in court, how he threatened Jack's life. That bastard makes parole and two months later.. TWO MONTHS LATER! Donna breaks down. She can't go on.

All right, Donna. We'll talk tomorrow. This is Officer Geary. He's gonna make sure you get home.  17. A UNIFORM COP gently leads Donna away. Delgetty turns to Tony and Loomis. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) For the record. I'm not yelling.
You never yell. I wish you would.
We need this in the bag. Immediately. She was right about your old man. We've got to talk to him.
Iwill. I'll do it. He's coming to my kid's baseball game. (to Loomis) Can you cover the autopsy? I'll meet you back in the war room. Loomis nods. Tony starts for the door.
Detective. (Tony turns) Big Tony. It's not possible, is it? Tony considers this.

A LITTLE LEAGUE GAME is in progress. Tony is behind the plate, umpiring, with his old-fashioned BALL AND STRIKE CLICKER. A QUICK MONTAGE: Tony calling pitches.. calling plays, et He carefully, obsessively sweeps off home plate.
In the stands, watching this: Tony's ex wife, KAYLA, and partner, AVERY. They're newlyweds. Both smart professionals.
I still can't picture it. You and him.
It wasn't all terrible. The house was always clean. Look at home plate. That was our house. Kayla gestures "blowing her brains out". Big Tony appears juggling BEER and HOT DOGS.
(to OTHER PARENTS) Can I sit here? We're family. Thank you. Big Tony squeezes in. He and Kayla and Avery exchange chilly, awkward greetings. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Has he been up?
Twice.
How'd he do? Wait, don't tell me. Ignorance is bliss.
If ignorance were bliss, Tony, you'd be having orgasms all day.
Maybe I am. (yelling, playfully)

head_text.subj: LET'S GET A REAL UMP IN THERE

text: Tony tries to ignore HIS OWN FATHER HECKLING HIM.
The BATTER pops out.  19.
He's out. (to Kayla & Avery) Just like you guys.
The game continues. The next batter is EVAN, Tony and Kayla's son.
I can't look. Evan takes a pitch.

(quietly, to Evan) Good eye, buddy. Wait for your pitch. The next pitch. Evan connects! The FIRST BASEMAN fields t ball. It's a funny, sloppy play; typical little league stuff. Evan dodges the tag. The First Baseman chases him around. Finally, somehow, Evan reaches first base. He's safe!
You're OUT! Out?!? A confused beat.
Dad!? He missed me by a mile!
You were out of the baseline. Sorry, buddy. The PARENTS BOO. The PLAYERS BOO. EVERYONE BOOS.
If you break one rule, what happens? That's right. They all break.  20.
Kayla, the ex-wife, knows what's coming.
Oh no. Not the rulebook..
Tony takes out a RULE BOOK. The LOUD BOOING continues.
Here it is. 15 J. "A batter/runner cannot deviate more than 3 feet from the baseline while avoiding the tag". Evan sighs, and sulks away.
Good hit though. Way to hustle.
The game is over. The PLAYERS are collecting their stuff. Kayla and Avery step up. Tony and the women exchange tens overly-polite greetings. Divorces are tough.
Could I see that rule book? I'm just curious. Kayla takes the RULE BOOK.. and playfully FOLDS it.
Oh look. It bends. Unlike the umpire.
I get it. Very cute. Well, I think he learned a valuable lesson.
Oh we ALL learned a lesson, Tony. How's tomorrow morning?  21.
I'll have to call you. An ex cop was killed, so it's all hands on deck.
Well, let me know. Kayla and Avery & Evan walk away. Big Tony IMPROVISES a sweet goodbye with his grandson. Then he crosses to Tony.
An ex cop?
I was about to tell you. It was Jack Livingston. They found him this morning in Ambrose Park.
How?
It wasn't pretty. Abducted. Drugged. Suffocated. Then shot.
I wouldn't have done it in that order, but still-
Jesus! Dad!
I'm not gonna lie to you. I have mixed feelings here.
Where would you start?
If it was my case? I'd be looking at me. Tony gestures, "be serious". BIG TONY (CONT’D) Why not? Who has a better motive? I did 12 birthdays inside for that bastard. (grins) (MORE )
Maybe I'm your blind spot. Every cop has one.
Are you gonna help me here or not?
Livingston took five other cops down with me. Every one of ‘em told me they'd take him out if they could.
You believe them?
I did at the time. But that was 12 years ago. Grudges have a way of, what's the word?- dissipating.
I heard he was broke. I heard he owed the Newmark Brothers.
They're serious people. But what you described- abducted, drugged, shot- it doesn't sound like business. It sounds personal. Have you met the wife?
Donna.
She's a real people-pleaser. Half of Brooklyn would love a ride on that pony. (chuckles ) You've got your work cut out for you. There won't be a lot of tears at that funeral.

The All City Task Force occupies a LARGE ATTIC-LOFT of th old precinct building. Old school. Wooden desks. Piles of case files. These detectives are overworked and underfund  23. A CASE BOARD dominates the room. It says "LIST OF POSSIBLES". Underneath: 14 HEADSHOTS of assorted local lowlifes. Meet RYAN Earnest. an iPAD.
My old man was right. Bookies, cops, ex cops, gangbangers. Half the borough had it in for this guy.
Lieutenant? Dr. Zee just posted the autopsy. DOMKI, the squad's civilian technician. 20's. Eager to please.. a little TOO eager. He holds up
I can't read it from here, Ryan.
Oh. Sorry. (reading) "Name of deceased: Jack Livingston. Well nourished male Caucasian. 178 pounds. Height, 70 inches.."
Ryan, Ryan, I just need the headlines. Time of death?
Sorry. "Between 4 PM Saturday and 4 AM Sunday."
That's a pretty big window.
He had eight mills of nembutal in his blood. Probably injected with a syringe.
They jacked him up before they killed him.
Yes sir. That's my conclusion as well. (resumes ) (MORE)
"C.0.D.: acute asphyxia." That would be the plastic bag. Then, postmortem, five gunshots, 9 millimeter, upper chest.
Five shots after he died. Cowboy? What do you think?

Sound premeditated. (then) Back in the day, a case like this, I'd run it past your old man. (to Ryan) Big Tony was the best street cop I ever knew. Every morning, they'd be four, five detectives outside his office, waiting to run their cases past him.
He thinks we should look at the wife.
Rings true to me. The first time I met Donna Livingston she was dancing at a club by the airport and her name was Dory-Anne. This was two dead husbands ago. During this, faintly- BEEP BEEP BEEP.
What the hell? Ryan proudly indicates his HIGH-TECH WRIST WATCH.
That's me. It's called the VitaLink. I'm beta testing it for a friend. It has a skin sensor on the back. It reads your hydration level.
It's a watch that tells you when you're thirsty?
I guess, yeah. Pretty much.  25. The stupid watch continues to BEEP BEEP BEEP.
Does it tell you when you're being a douchbag? (BEEP BEEP BEEP..)
The answer is yes. BEEP BEEP BEEP. Ryan can't turn it off.
Just take it off.
Maybe if I.. Ryan gulps down some water, trying to turn it off. BEEP B BEEP BEEP..
If I killed you right now, no jury in the world would convict me. Finally, somehow, the watch stops.

Hey. Guys. We're on the job. Let's do the job. Ryan, check the phone records- his and hers. Make sure the DA's office is looped in. Cowboy, turn these guys over, check their alibis. We've gotta start clearing this board. Capt. Delgetty enters. She looks concerned.
Captain?

A few years back, during the troubles, we started stamping every round of ammunition that we issued, so every bullet discharged could be traced back to the officer who fired it. She holds up an EVIDENCE BAG containing FIVE SLUGS. CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) These are the slugs they just pulled out of Jack Livingston. (MORE )
CAPT. DELGETTY (CONT’D) I was there. They never left my sight. (beat) They're all stamped. They're department issued.
You're saying.. a cop did this?
They were issued to this unit. To one specific officer. She hands Tony a CLIPBOARD. A tense, expectant beat.
Who is it?
(reading list, baffled) It's me.
Lt. Caruso, I need you to surrender your weapon. And follow me. DEAD SILENCE. Tony, stunned, unholsters his Glock and han it to her. Then- BEEP BEEP. It's Ryan's stupid watch.
Sorry. Ryan drinks water, frantically, trying to turn it off.

head_text.subj: INT. POLICE BALLISTICS LAB- MOMENTS LATER

text: Later. They're testing Tony's weapon. A POLICE TECHNICIAN fits and locks the gun into a metallic vice, then attache wire to the trigger. Capt. Delgetty and Tony watch, anxiously. Everyone puts on ear-protectors. BLAM! A bullet is fired into a TESTING CHAMBER filled with ORDINANCE GELITAN. The Technician digs the bullet from the gelitan, washes i off, and places it in a COMPARISON MICROSCOPE. MICROSCOPE POV: The two bullets. Side by side. They're rotated until the grooves and striations line up.  27. The Technician looks up, concerned. Tony steps up to the microscope, and looks for himself. He reacts, stunned. They're identical.

head_text.subj: INT. CONFERENCE ROOM- POLICE STATION- LATER

text: Later. Tony is being questioned by Captain Delgetty and QUINN, a skeptical officer from Internal Affairs. Sitting beside Tony is a POLICE UNION REP.

Has everyone been sworn? Note the time. (starting a TAPE RECORDER) I am Matthew Quinn, Senior Inspector, Internal Affairs. I'm here with Capt. R.H. Delgetty. We're talking to Detective Anthony Caruso. Detective, is there anything you'd like to tell us?
There's been a mistake.

I hope you're right, son. Quinn indicates the Glock on the table, in an EVIDENCE BA INSPECTOR QUINN (CONT’D) We have your gun here. According to the ballistics, this is the weapon that killed Jack Livingston.
Excuse me. The union doesn't consider those results definitive. Lt. Caruso has a right to retest the weapon in an independent lab-
(overruling his own counsel) That won't be necessary. I'll stipulate the shots came from my gun. I ran the test myself, twice.
Ah.. I'd like to talk to Tony privately-  28.
There's no need for that. We're all here for the same reason, right? We're trying to figure out what happened.
Absolutely. We're just trying to figure this out.
Then let's start here: What possible motive could he have? He barely knew the victim.
Family honor.

Family honor? Twelve years after the trial? Where does I.A. get the nerve? (waving a PRINT OUT) Have you seen his record? Not a single complaint. You could eat off this. You know what they call him around here?
The Choirboy.
That's right. The Choirboy. He doesn't step out, he doesn't drink, he doesn't curse. Most cops I know won't work with him, he's such a Goddamn pain in the ass.
Thank you, Phil.
We'll stipulate. It's an admirable record. (resuming) Let's talk about the weapon. When was it issued?
Eight years ago. Same day I got my shield. Best day of my life.  29.
You keep it with you? Tony pats his EMPTY SHOULDER HOLSTER.
Did you ever loan it to anyone?
Never.
Did you ever lose track of it? For an hour? It happens.
Not to me.
Tony, you said 24-7, but that's not really possible. When you take a shower. .?
It's on the counter by the sink. It's never out of my sight.
You've got to sleep.
It's next to the bed. In my nightstand. In the top drawer.
Is the drawer locked?
No.
Jack Livingston was killed some time on Saturday, possibly Sunday morning. We know where you were during the day. Tell us about Saturday night.  30.
I was at Dino's, watching the playoffs.
Until when?
Ten thirty. Home by eleven, asleep by midnight. Life in the fast lane.
Did you sleep alone?
Yes sir.
And the Glock was..?
In the drawer. All night.
You don't know that, do you? I mean, you were sleeping. Somebody could've taken it, and returned it two hours later. Tony considers this.
You live with your father, don't you? BOOM. The question hits Tony like a hammer.

In the Squad Room. The CASE BOARD illustrates the episode baffling puzzle: Across the top it says: LIST OF POSSIBLES. Underneath are TWO HEADSHOTS. One of Tony. One of his father. Our two leads. It had to one of them. Loomis and Ryan look at the board. In shock.  31.
Help me Rhonda.
It's raining. Tony is walking to his car.
Caruso. Gabby is there. In the rain. Waiting for him.
Did they take your badge?
Not yet. Modified duty. I'm riding my desk, pending a departmental review. (pushing past her) I'm meeting somebody, so.. But Gabby stops him.
I need a minute here. I just have to look you in the eye. (she does, intently) I can handle being wrong. I've been wrong before. But I have to know.
I don't know what happened, Gabby.
You can talk to me. There's nobody else here.
I don't know what happened.
I've been vouching for your father. I put my ass on the line.
I know you have.  32.
My C.O. wants him back inside. Everybody does. But I've been vouching for him. Because.. I trust my gut. I think he has a good heart.
Why do you say that?
You. He raised you. (then) If it was him, if he did this thing, I've never been wronger about anybody.
Me too.

head_text.subj: EXT. FRONT HALL- CARUSO HOUSE- NIGHT

text: Tony arrives home. He CALLS OUT-
Hello? Dad? No response.
Later. Tony is calling around, looking for his father.

(into PHONE) No, he's not there. Well if he checks in, tell him to call me. Tell him it's important. Tony hangs up. He sighs. He considers the WALL OF FAMILY PHOTOS. He focuses on a photo of CONNIE, his late mother.

Morning. In Queens. A BUSY INTERSECTION in a marginal neighborhood. A strip mall. Some apartment buildings. To the rest of the world, it's just another street corner To Tony and his father, it's sacred ground.  33. Tony parks. He climbs out carrying a BOUQUET OF FLOWERS. tapes the flowers to a streetlight. A makeshift memorial. He notices: ANOTHER BOUQUET, already there. Big Tony is sitting nearby, on a BUS STOP BENCH.
Have you been here all night? Big Tony gestures, "where else would I go?"
Fourteen years tomorrow. Tony sits beside his father. He indicates the FLOWERS.
You gotta tape them up. They'll blow away.
Let 'em go. She never liked getting flowers. She hated watching them die. (re: APARTMENT BUILDING) How many people live there? Three hundred?
Maybe more.
Nobody saw anything? Or heard anything?
It was after midnight-
(bitterly) He dragged her fifty feet. He never even slowed down.
The bank camera caught part of it.
A yellow minivan, possible Jersey plates. That's nothing.  34.
It's something. It might be enough. I'll never stop looking, you know that.
That sonofabitch better pray to God you find him before I do. Then, gingerly..
Dad. We need to talk. Can we go someplace?
We are someplace. What's going on?
I can't do it here. (then, giving in) Jack Livingston was killed with my gun.
Your Glock? That's not possible.
It's more that possible. It's a statement of fact.
I'll ask around. I still got a lot of chips out there-
You can't ask around, Dad. They're looking at you.
Who's looking at me?
(pointedly) You threatened him. In public.
I say things-
You threatened him on multiple occasions.  35.
I say a lot of things. What are you- ? You come here? To this corner? This is sacred ground! Big Tony is too upset to continue. He walks away. He collects himself, then returns.
Who am I talking to here, you or the badge?
I am the badge.
Let's be very careful here, Anthony. Let's not say anything we're not gonna regret. I've had people tuned up-
Dad-
Maybe I tuned some people up myself. I don't deny that. But I never crossed the line. I never killed nobody. You know that.

Here's what I know. Livingston was shot sometime on Saturday with my gun- MY GUN- which was never out of my sight except while I slept. It's all about access, dad. The front door was locked. The back door was locked. The only people in the house were you and me.
And Gunther.
(stunned) And.. Gunther?
Downtown. A CITY CONSTRUCTION CREW is laying asphalt. We focus on one worker: GUNTHER WELLES. Amiable. Middle aged  36.
A block away. Tony & Big Tony are parked in TONY'S SEDAN. It's a father-son stakeout.
(reading a RAP SHEET) Gunther Luther Welles. A couple of jolts, nothing major. Resisting arrest, possession with intent. How do you know this jerk?
We used to work together. Stealing copper wire from construction sites.
And you don't feel any shame?
Shame isn't one of my virtues.
Virtue isn't one of your virtues. So, Saturday night..?
Saturday night. You went to bed, what, midnight? I stayed up. I was watching the Food Network.
I know what you were watching, Dad. I get the bill.

I call it the Food Network. Quarter to one. Ding dong. It's my old pal, Gunther. He's having a tough year. He's been living with his sister. They had a fight, something. She kicked him out. He needed a bed. At the car window: a DELIVERY KID appears with a BAG OF F
Caruso?
Right here.  37.
That's $12.50. Big Tony takes the BAG. Unwraps it. It's a calzone.
From Brody's Deli. Best calzone in the city.
We're on a stakeout. You can't have food delivered!
You really have a lot to learn. (gesturing "money") Do you have any..? Tony sighs and pays for the food.
So Gunther Welles..?
We talked for an hour. I went upstairs. He crashed on the red couch in basement.
And he was there all night?
As far as I know. He was there when I woke up. You must've missed him.
Back in the Squad Room. Our team is assembled: Tony, Loom and Ryan. Gabby has joined them, too. Ryan adds GUNTHER WELLES' PHOTO to the CASE BOARD. Finall they have a third suspect.
Thanks for inviting me.
A fresh set of eyes, always helpful.  38.
Gunther Welles? Never heard of him. Does he have anything resembling a motive?

As a matter of fact.. (reading from iPAD) He had an uncle, Martin Welles. AKA Manny Corkrin, AKA Manny DeAngelos. Uncle Marty was arrested, 1998, possession with intent. Guess who the arresting officer was.
Jack Livingston.
Uncle Manny drew 5 to 10 and died in prison.
Is that it?
I know it's thin.
I wish I was that thin.
It's something. It's a connection.
Let's play it out. For kicks and giggles. Here's your house.. Gabby crosses to a DRY ERASE BOARD. She sketches a crude FLOOR PLAN of a three-story house.
This is you. This is your dad. She draws TWO STICK FIGURES asleep in bed.
Gunther Welles is in the basement. At some point after one AM, he sneaks upstairs. He finds your room. He enters your room. He finds your gun..  39.
In the dark. Without waking you up.
I have a sound machine.
A sound machine. God help us.

He sneaks out of the house. He finds Jack Livingston, drugs him, strangles him, shoots him five times, then carries the body to Ambrose Park and dumps it by the trail. They're interrupted. BEEP BEEP BEEP. It's Ryan's awful watch. Loomis grabs a PITCHER OF WATER.. crosses to Ryan.. and calmly pours water onto Ryans's hand, drowning the watch.
Not cool, man.
(resuming) Ambrose Park..?
He dumps the body, then sneaks back into the house, locks the door behind him, returns the gun, then goes back downstairs. Everyone considers this.
What do you think?
The DA's never gonna buy it.
It's all we've got. It was my gun. Nothing else makes sense.  40.
You people aren't even asking the right question. Has anyone read this? He holds up an AUTOPSY DIAGRAM of the BULLET-RIDDLED BODY
None of these bullets passed through the body, so the shooter had to be at least 20 yards away. Look at that grouping. From 20 yards? Who is this guy, Daniel Boone? Where'd he learn to shoot?
He's not ex-military.
Has he ever fired a gun in his life?
Can we ask him?
We can ask but it won't do any good.
Why not?
The golden rule, kid. The first thing every homicide investigator learns-
Murderers lie.
Murderers. Lie. They're stumped. Then-
I have an idea. (to Tony) You're not gonna like it.  41.
The joint is quiet, nearly empty. Tony, Gabby and Loomis at a table with their suspect, Gunther Welles. They're having a friendly chat. Laughs. Drinks. A CLASSIC ROCK SONG plays.
I love the old songs. Why doesn't anybody write old songs anymore? Loomis fills Gunther's glass.
I've been braced before, but never like this.
You're a friend of my father's. You get the VIP treatment.
You can buy me drinks till the moon turns blue, it won't change my story.
We're just talking, Gunther. A friendly chat. You were telling us about your Uncle Manny..
Like I said. He was a mean old prick. I'm surprised his own shadow kept him company. During this, TWO BADASS GANGSTERS enter the bar. They loo around, warily. THEY'RE CASING THE PLACE.
You weren't angry when he died? In prison? Alone?
You didn't hold anyone responsible?
Why should I?
Okay. We'll come back to that. Let's talk about Saturday night.  42.
Nothing to tell. My sister brought a guy home and they kicked me out. It happens every few weeks. I knocked on a few doors and ended up in your basement.
Sorry about the smell, by the way.
Hell, I'm up to my ass in asphalt all day. Nothing bothers me.
The GANGSTERS pull their GUNS! EVERYONE TENSES, FREEZES. FIRST GANGSTER (CONT’D) The drawer.
We just opened. There won't be much.
We'll take what you have.
Hey. Douchebag. You know where you are?
Excuse me?
This is Dinos. It's a cop bar. We're all blue.
Well. That makes it even sweeter. While everyone is distracted, the Bartender pulls a SAWED from under the bar.

The Bartender FIRES! BLAM! The SECOND GANGSTER collapses, dead.  43. ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE! The FIRST GANGSTER spins, fires! BLAM BLAM! The Bartender collapses. He's dead. Gabby and Loomis scramble and return fire! BLAM BLAM! Gunther cowers behind the table. BLAM! Loomis is SHOT IN THE CHEST. He collapses. He's dead. You read that right. Loomis is dead. As he falls, his SERVICE REVOLVER- a Glock 19- flies loose and slides across the floor. It stops near Gunther.
(into CELLPHONE)

The gunfight continues. BLAM BLAM! GABBY IS SHOT. She collapses. She's dead. Tony is shot, too. He's hit in the chest, seriously wounded. Then it's over. The aftermath: blood and bodies everywher The Surviving Gangster crosses.. menacingly.. toward Tony

Sorry brother. Gotta finish it. No witnesses. He AIMS AT TONY. Tony braces himself. This is the end. Bu CLICK!- the gun is empty. The Gangster starts to reload. Gunther, of all people, is the last man standing. He's st cowering behind the table. LOOMIS'S GLOCK is within reach
Gunther! The gun! GRAB THE GUN!

Gunther grabs Loomis's gun. He stands. He's shaking. He fumbles with the safety, closes his eyes and- BLAM BLAM!- FIRES WILDLY! The recoil sends him flying backwards! A beat. Then.. Tony sits up.. unhurt! The gunshots were fake. BODY SQUIB Loomis and Gabby sit up. The Bartender and the Gangster stand. IT WAS ALL STAGED. They applaud each other's "performance".
All those improv classes finally paid off.
What's going on..?
(introducing the "Gangsters" ) Gunther Welles, meet Lt. Marson and Sgt. Diaz.

We were testing you, Gunther. This is a Glock 19. The same model as the murder weapon. You've never fired a gun in your life, have you? (Gunther shakes his head) I didn't think so. (to Tony) Now we know. Suddenly- BAM!- Loomis is "Shot" again. Another SQUIB CHA ON HIS CHEST explodes. Ryan appears, holding a SFX CONTROL BOX. He's been the "stunt coordinator", controlling SQUIB CHARGES from behin the bar.
Sorry. BAM! Another SQUIB on Loomis explodes. Ryan pretends the controller is broken.
(mock surprise) Sorry. Sorry. I think it's stuck.
Cut it out, kid. I mean it. It's not funny..

Later. Tony is in the Squad Room. Alone. He studies the LIST OF POSSIBLES on the CASE BOARD. GUNTHER'S PHOTO has been moved to the bottom. He's been eliminated. So.. they're back to TWO SUSPECTS. TWO PHOTOS. One of Ton One of his father. Gabby appears in the doorway, carrying her MOTORCYCLE HEL and a BOTTLE OF WINE.  45.
You can't avoid it forever.
What's that?
Going home.
(ruefully) You should be a detective.
I'm thinking about it. There's an exam in March.
I'm serious.
So am I. If you can do it, how hard can it be? Gabby sits. She makes herself comfortable. She pours herself a glass of wine.
(ve: the CASE BOARD) We're back where we started. You'll have to testify.
I am aware. As always, Tony is playing BOSSA NOVA music.
Bossa nova?
It helps me think.

(offering the BOTTLE) You want some of this? It helps me NOT think. (Tony demurs) I forgot. The Choirboy. Gabby considers Tony's carefully organized desk. She pick up a PILE OF REPORTS and MIXES THEM UP.  46.
What are you doing?! No don't- Gabby! (sighing, fixing his desk) Why do you torture me?
I can't resist. You're so.. damn.. good. I bet you don't pee in the shower.
Do you want me to pee in the shower? Would that make you happy? Their eyes meet. Tony considers her, warmly. Tony nods.
How was your childhood?
How was my childhood? (a painful subject) I didn't really have one. Thanks for asking. How was yours?
Outstanding, until my mother died. Whatever we needed, whatever we wanted, the old man took care of it. Diamond Tony Caruso. A house in Florida. A new car every year. Seats behind the dugout..
And you never suspected?
I never asked.
You were afraid to ask. She's right again.
What about your mom?
I think she knew. She had to know.  47.
They don't wash off easily, do they?
What's that?
The sins of the father.
Later. Tony arrives home. He starts upstairs. Big Tony appears. He's been waiting up. Both men are guarded. Suspicious of the other.
I was worried.
About who? This, of course, is THE question. A tense beat.
Gunther told me he's been officially cleared.
That's right.

We'll talk about it later. Come here. Big Tony embraces his son. They HUG. Tightly. Big Tony pats Tony's back. He pats Tony's lower back. Then he pats Tony's chest. Pat pat pat. HE'S LOOKING FOR A WIRE. Defiantly, Tony removes his shirt and his undershirt. He stands there, exposed, to prove he's not wired.
There's some tortellini in the fridge.  48.
I'm good. See you tomorrow.
I love you.
I love you, too. Tony walks into his bedroom, and closes the door.

head_text.subj: EXT. DONNA LIVINGSTON'S HOUSE- STATEN ISLAND- DAY

text: A modest house on Staten Island. A cop's house. DOZENS OF CARS parked out front. FAMILY AND MOURNERS are arriving.

head_text.subj: INT. LIVINGSTON HOUSE- LIVING ROOM- DAY

text: Inside. A MEMORIAL RECEPTION is in progress. On a table: display of PHOTOS memorializing Jack Livingston. The house is crowded with SOMBER MOURNERS. Some are FAMIL Some are COPS. Donna Livingston, the grieving widow, sits and quietly receives them.
It was a beautiful service... Sorry for your loss.. (etc)
Do they know who did it?
(bitterly) They know exactly who did it. They have all the evidence they need. (LOUDLY, to the room) But they're too chickenshit to do anything.
Shhh.
I don't care who hears me!
At the door. Tony arrives. Loomis intercepts him.
Are you mental? What are you doing here?
I had to show up. How would it look?
It would look like you had some common sense. Donna's on the warpath. She's threatening to call the Post.
What does she want?
She wants an arrest. Yesterday.
My father?
Or you. Or both. She doesn't seem particular. (sighs ) All right. But stay out of the way. Stay in the bathroom. Donna has a NASTY DOG. It GROWLS and SNARLS at Tony.
(pulling the DOG away) Maisy! No! She's like that with everybody, until she gets to know you.

The reception continues. SHOTS OF MOURNERS talking quietl drinking. Maisy the dog SNARLS at various guests. Tony is in the kitchen, sipping ginger ale, trying to be inconspicuous. A FAMILY MEMBER walks past.
How you doing? The Family Member doesn't respond. Tony is a leper.  50.
Across the room: Donna Livingston is with her linebacker- BROTHER. She notices Tony.
He's got nerve, I'll give him that.
You want me to- ?
No no. Not here.
The reception continues. Capt. Delgetty and Loomis talk privately.

This is the damndest case I ever saw. Diamond Tony Caruso was crooked as hell, but he was a first- rate detective. Why would he use that gun? He knew we could trace it back to his own house. It doesn't make sense.
A lot of things don't make sense. Why are pennies bigger than dimes?
I guess that's true..
Why does Hawaii have an Interstate highway?
You have a good point..
Why doesn't Tarzan have a beard?
(losing her patience) I don't know.  51.
Why did the Flintstones celebrate Christmas?
When are you retiring?
474 days.
Including today?
Across the room. SGT. CHET FINCH- who we met earlier- is talking to SOME RELATIVES. Finch has a rash; he absentmindedly scratches his ankle.
I've never been up this way. Nice area.

I remember when Jack and Donna moved in, it was all woods.. They improvise a friendly conversation. During this, Donn dog AFFECTIONATELY RUBS AGAINST FINCH. Finch pets the dog They obviously know each other.
(to the dog) Hey sweetheart. I miss you too. Across the room: Tony is clocking this.

The reception continues. At one point, Donna walks upstai No one notices. A beat. Sgt. Finch excuses himself, then nonchalantly follows Donna up the stairs. Tony has been watching them. He casually follows them, up the stairs..  52.
Donna and Chet Finch are lovers. They're in an UPSTAIRS BEDROOM. Whispering. Embracing. Kissing hungrily.
Chet.. what are you doing? We agreed.. we have to wait.. Tony opens the door. They break off, startled.
Knock knock.
Caruso- ?!
Are you lost?
(pointedly) I was lost. I'm not quite as lost as I was.
(recovering) Donna's an old friend. She needed to talk..
Obviously. Finch SCRATCHES HIS LEG AGAIN.
Are you okay, Sergeant? You've been scratching your leg all night.
It's a rash.
From here, it looks like poison sumac. (then, accusingly) How did you do it?
Do what?  53.
Kill Jack Livingston with my gun. Before the couple can respond, Loomis appears.
Tony- !
Cowboy! Is the Captain still here?
She sent me to find you-
(excitedly) He's the guy. They're in it together! I don't know how they did it, but they did it-
Tony-
Remember the poison sumac by the clearing? Check his left leg, they can match it in the lab-
Tony- Tony- it's over.
(finally focusing) What's over?
The case. They're closing it. (then) Your father just confessed.

head_text.subj: INT. STATE PRISON- VISITING AREA- LATER

text: Tony is visiting his father. Big Tony is in prison overal He's doing what a good parent does: he's masking his fear and reassuring his son..
You don't remember Harry Corkrin? Harry The Horse? He's practically your Godfather. (MORE )
He's two cells over. I got more friends in here than I do outside. During this, Big Tony is shamelessly smoking a CIGAR.
You can't smoke in here.
No. YOU can't smoke in here. (resuming) Plus I'm eating better. Plus I don't have to listen to your fakakta bossa nova. Don't worry about me, kid. The devil watches over his own.
You didn't answer my question. Why'd you sign that statement?
Because I did it. I killed him.
No you didn't.

You're a good cop, Tony. But you're not a father. (heartfelt) I'd take a bullet for you. Don't you know that? (clarifying) Not in the gut. The leg maybe. A flesh wound. Or the thigh. A PRISON GUARD appears, as a waiter would, with a MUG OF COFFEE. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Thank you, Corey. Is there any of that cinnamon? The GUARD adds some cinnamon to the coffee.
You think I did it? You think you're protecting me?  55.
(gesturing: people might hear) Hey.
I didn't kill anybody.
Of course you didn't.
It wasn't either of us. It was Chet Finch!
Finch?
And Livingston's wife. They planned it together.
With your gun? (beat) How? Tony doesn't know. He doesn't respond.
It's not possible.

head_text.subj: EXT. STATE PRISON- VISITOR PARKING- LATER

text: Moments later. Tony is leaving the prison. He drives out the VISITOR PARKING LOT. He doesn't notice: Sgt. Finch is parked nearby. Tony driv away. Finch follows him.
That night. Tony and his son, Evan, are in the KITCHEN. Evan is staring, glumly, at a slice of PIZZA.
You have to eat. I promised your mom.  56.
What are these?
Olives. Evan removes the BLACK OLIVES. He places them on a white platter, one at a time.
Have you ever had one? Let's try one. Let's be brave.
I don't want to be brave.

Well, that's probably a sign of intelligence. Tony considers the FIVE BLACK OLIVES on the white platter THE PATTERN LOOKS FAMILIAR. Tony rearranges them. Suddenly- AN IDEA! Tony excitedly finds the CASE FILE and opens it.
What are you doing? Tony is distracted. Focusing on the file.
Dad?
I think you might have just solved my case! Get your coat. I'm taking you home.
Moments later. Gabby is waiting on a street corner. Tony comes SCREECHING UP in his car. He flings open the door-
What couldn't wait?  57.
Gabby & Tony in Tony's car. They're speeding north, towar the Bronx.
I need someone to tell me if I'm crazy.
You're not crazy, Caruso. You're just rebelling against a father who you love but could never count on or trust-
Not me. The case. I think I know who shot Jack Livingston.
Who was it?
I think it was me. I shot him, but I didn't know I shot him.
Ask me if you're crazy again.
It was a set up. Gabby, it was brilliant. It was a work of art..

As Tony explains, we SEE THE CRIME IN A STYLIZED BLACK & WHITE FLASHBACK.. Jack Livingston is in bed, fast asleep. Donna is injectin him with a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE. Her lover, Sgt. Chet Finch, nearby, watching.
It was Finch and Donna Livingston. They jacked him up, probably while he slept..

head_text.subj: INT. TONY'S CAR- DRIVING- NIGHT- PRESENT DAY

text: Resume present day. In Tony's car-  58.
At some point, later that day, they killed him with the trash bag. Suffocation. Then- and this is the brilliant part- they brought the body to Rodman's Neck.
Rodman's Neck?
The FLASHBACKS RESUME. We're back where the episode start at the OUTDOOR POLICE TRAINING FACILITY.
It's a training facility in the Bronx. We have to go every year to get recertified.
We're "backstage" at the shooting range, behind the woode targets. Finch and Donna are strapping LIVINGSTON'S BODY the BACK OF A LIFESIZE WOODEN TARGET.
Finch is the on-site supervisor. He knew I was scheduled to shoot that day, at 5:30.

Remember the first scene in the episode? We replay it now Tony is at the practice range. A LIFESIZE PAPER TARGET ro into view. Tony fires! BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM! Five shots. A tight cluster, around the heart. Except NOW we see BEHIND the target. LIVINGSTON'S BODY IS STRAPPED UPRIGHT TO THE BOARD. It's a horrific image. The bullets pass through the wood, and riddle the lifeless bo
Oh my God!  59.
They knew my old man would be suspect number one. The ballistic test would seal the deal.

head_text.subj: INT. TONY'S CAR- DRIVING- NIGHT- PRESENT DAY

text: RESUME PRESENT DAY. Gabby and Tony in Tony's car.
So you killed him?!
No no no no no no. He was already dead, remember? Thank God.
When did you figure all this? Tony hands her the BODY DIAGRAM from Livingston's autopsy The FIVE BULLET HOLES are clearly marked.
I knew that cluster pattern looked familiar.
Wait. Hold on. You remembered the pattern of the bullets holes, from, like, ten days ago?
I guess I did.
From one target? Out of how many, twenty? Caruso, that's not normal. That's pretty freaky.
It's a pretty distinctive pattern. It's an almost perfect hexagon-
A perfect hexagon? It's five random holes. You're a freak of nature, Caruso. You're like Rainman-  60.
(interrupting, annoyed) Excuse me. I have a plan. Would you like to know where we're going?
To Professor Xavier's mansion, to pick up the other mutants?
That's right. We're going to Professor Xavier's mansion to pick up the other mutants. Tony's car continues north. They don't notice: SGT. FINCH'S CAR, a block behind, following them...

head_text.subj: EXT. POLICE TRAINING FACILITY- BRONX- FRONT GATE- NIGHT

text: It's late. The facility is closed. Tony's car approaches the FRONT GATE. Tony knows the security code and punches it in. The gate swings open.

head_text.subj: INT. TRAINING FACILITY- MAIN OFFICE- NIGHT

text: Moments later. The MAIN OFFICE is empty and dark. Tony an Gabby are looking around.
Maybe he threw it out.
They're supposed to keep them here for ten days, until they're officially recorded. Here they are. They've found an OVERSIZE BIN filled with USED PAPER SILHOUETTE TARGETS.

head_text.subj: EXT. POLICE TRAINING FACILITY- FRONT GATE- SAME TIME

text: Out front. Sgt. Finch arrives!  61.

head_text.subj: INT. TRAINING FACILITY- MAIN OFFICE- NIGHT

text: Inside. Tony and Gabby are still searching through the PA TARGETS. Until..
"May 24. Caruso, Junior". She pulls out the BULLET-RIDDLED TARGET. Tony has brought the AUTOPSY DIAGRAM. They compare the pattern of holes. Tony was right. They're identical.
Wow. Is that enough?
It's more than enough. It's incontrovertible. Gabby starts to roll up the target.
Don't touch it. We have to preserve the chain of evidence. We'll come back tomorrow with a warrant.
At least take a picture. Gabby takes a QUICK PHOTO of the paper target.

head_text.subj: EXT. PARKING LOT- TRAINING FACILITY- MOMENTS LATER

text: Tony & Gabby walk back to Tony's car.
Were you serious about taking the exam?
Are you hiring?
Maybe we are. I could talk to the Captain. Suddenly they stop. The hood of Tony's car is open. The DISTRIBUTOR CAP has been ripped out.  62.
Right there. Right there. They turn. Sgt. Finch is pointing a GUN at them.
First your phones. Let's drop them. Tony and Gabby slowly take out their CELL PHONES, and dro them.
You don't want to do this, Chet. You're not a murderer.
(reminding him) He is a murderer. That's why we're here.
Now your guns. You first. Tony opens his jacket. No holster. No gun.
(gloating) Oh I forgot. It's in the evidence room. It is, after all, a murder weapon. (then) Inspector? Gabby opens her jacket. No weapon.
I left it home.
Why would you do that? You're on the job.
When he called, all he said was he wanted to see me. (embarrassed) I thought he was asking me out.
(surprised, flattered) Really?  63. Now we reveal: Gabby really DOES have a gun! It's holster behind her, out of sight. She SLOWLY REACHES FOR IT, as..
I thought I covered every angle. How did you figure it?
He remembered the pattern of the bullet holes.
From one target? From ten days ago? It's not possible.
That's what I said!
It was a unique pattern. It's an almost perfect hexagon- (to Gabby) Was that true? You thought I was asking you out?
No. Sorry. Suddenly Gabby pulls her GUN- spins- and BLAM!- fires at Finch! Finch DIVES OUT THE WAY! Tony & Gabby scramble awa They race toward the OUTDOOR TARGET RANGE..

Tony and Gabby run through the dark, quiet, sprawling TAR RANGE. Past PROP BUILDINGS and WOODEN CARS. It's other- worldly. Suddenly- FLOOD LIGHTS! The range is bathed in light. Ton and Gabby are exposed! BLAM BLAM! Finch fires at them! But from where? Tony and Gabby scramble away. Now the TARGETS are switche on! A MECHANICAL GOON SWINGS into view. TWANGGG! Gabby spins, fires! BLAM BLAM! More TARGETS POP UP! TWANGGGG!
Cat and mouse. They stalk each other.. warily, silently. Tony hides behind a MECHANICAL TARGET. Suddenly it SWINGS AWAY! Oh shit! He's exposed! Finch fires- BLAM BLAM! Tony dives away just in time!
Tony and Gabby take cover behind a WOODEN CAR. BLAM BLAM! Shots whiz past them! They're pinned down. They huddle together. They're close. They're touching.
Jiminy Cricket!
"Jiminy Cricket"? This is a gunfight, Caruso. You're allowed to curse.
Give me the gun.
I got him.
Give me the gun. I'ma better shot.
Because you're a guy? Tony grabs the gun from her. He checks the clip. It's almost empty.
Do you have another clip? Gabby shakes her head.
How many rounds?
One.
Make it count.
You think?  65.

Twenty yards away: Finch is hiding behind a facade. Finch hears: CLICK CLICK CLICK. It's obviously Tony, tryi to fire his gun, which is empty. CLICK CLICK. Finch smirks. He confidently steps into the open. Tony is standing there, in the open, holding the empty weapon. It continues to CLICK CLICK CLICK. Finch raises his gun. He's about to execute Tony. But-— BLAM! Tony's gun ISN'T empty! He had one round left. He shot Finch in the shoulder. Finch falls, wounded. He drops his gun. It's all over. Tony kicks Finch's gun away. Gabby joins him. Finch looks at Tony, defeated, baffled. Now Tony reveals how he made the CLICKING sound: he's hol the UMPIRE'S BALL AND STRIKE COUNTER. CLICK CLICK CLICK.

head_text.subj: INT. STATE PRISON- LOUNGE AREA- NEXT DAY

text: In a common room. SOME PRISONERS, including Big Tony, are watching the news. ON THE MONITOR: a perp walk. Sgt. Finc and Donna Livingston are being led into a police station.
The victim's widow and Sergeant Chet Finch are being held without bail. They're both charged with conspiracy and aggravated homicide... Big Tony grins.
I guess I better start packing.
Across town. Gabby is at her desk. She's taking a practic test for the NYPD DETECTIVE'S EXAM..  66.

Meanwhile. In Queens. Tony has returned to the corner whe his mother was killed. He studies the crime scene like the great cop he is. The traffic. The apartment building. The strip mall. The line of sight. He's obsessed with the case. It's a wound that will never heal.

head_text.subj: EXT. STATE PRISON- PRISONER RELEASE AREA- DAY

text: The next day. At the STATE PRISON. The BIG GATE slides open. Big Tony emerges, carrying his personal effects bag Tony is standing beside his car, waiting.
(beaming) This never gets old.
What's that?
Me, getting sprung, you, here, waiting for me. It makes me think I did something right. They embrace.
I told you not to worry.

I wasn't worried for a minute. I had the second best cop in New York history on the case. The two Carusos climb into the car. Tony drives away. They go ten feet. There's a rusty, faded old sign: STOP H WAIT FOR GUARD. Tony obediently stops. BIG TONY (CONT’D) What are you doing?  67.
It says to wait.
You can go. That's an old sign. They changed the rule.
Let's give it a minute.
He's not coming. Just go! (sighs ) We can't be related. There's ANOTHER CAR behind them. It HONKS impatiently. BIG TONY (CONT’D) Did you get your gun back?
Yes I did.
Can I borrow it?
